basically, you need superuser priveledges to edit that file.  i'm not sure how exactly this is handled through graphical editors.  i can tell you that if you go to a command prompt and type "sudo nano /boot/grub/menu.lst" you will get an editor which can edit that file :)
perhaps "sudo gedit ..." would be easier.  i don't know
